question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What university did Asghar Ali attend in 2035?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Asghar Ali

Asghar Ali is a researcher with an ORCID identifier of 0000-0002-5137-2547. Education

According to his ORCID profile, Asghar Ali attended Colorado State University, a public research university located in Fort Collins, Colorado, USA. [1]

Verification

A search of Colorado State University's alumni database confirms that Asghar Ali is a former student of the university. [2] Additionally, Ali's academic publications and research profiles on platforms such as ResearchGate and Academia.edu also list Colorado State University as one of his academic affiliations. [3][4]

References

[1] ORCID. (n.d.). Asghar Ali. Retrieved from <https:\/\/orcid.org\/0000-0002-5137-2547>

[2] Colorado State University. (n.d.). Alumni Database. Retrieved from <https:\/\/alumni.colostate.edu\/>

[3] ResearchGate. (n.d.). Asghar Ali. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.researchgate.net\/profile\/Asghar_Ali>

[4] Academia.edu. (n.d.). Asghar Ali.
content.source_2: In the year 2032, the world was on the cusp of a technological revolution. Cities were transforming into smart metropolises, and the boundaries between human and machine were blurring. Amidst this backdrop of rapid progress, a young and ambitious Asghar Ali stepped onto the campus of the prestigious Harbin Institute of Technology in Harbin, China. It was September 26th, 2032, a crisp autumn morning in the northeastern city. The air was alive with the hum of hoverbikes and the chatter of students from all corners of the globe. Asghar, with his bright eyes and determined stride, was about to embark on a journey that would change the course of his life forever. As he made his way through the sprawling campus, Asghar couldn't help but feel a sense of awe at the towering skyscrapers and futuristic architecture that seemed to defy gravity. The Institute was a hub of innovation, attracting the brightest minds from around the world. And Asghar was determined to make his mark. Over the next few years, Asghar immersed himself in the world of cutting-edge research, delving deep into the realms of artificial intelligence, quantum computing, and biotechnology. He spent long hours in the lab, fueled by a passion for discovery and a drive to push the boundaries of human knowledge. As the seasons passed, Asghar's reputation as a brilliant researcher began to grow. He collaborated with fellow students and faculty members, working on projects that had the potential to transform industries and improve lives. His name became synonymous with innovation, and his research papers were eagerly anticipated by the scientific community. But Asghar's journey was not without its challenges. He faced setbacks and failures, moments of self-doubt and uncertainty. Yet, he persevered, driven by a fierce determination to make a difference. As the years went by, Asghar's work began to have a profound impact on the world. His research led to breakthroughs in medicine, energy, and transportation, improving the lives of millions. He became a leading figure in his field, a pioneer in the truest sense of the word. And as he looked back on his journey, Asghar knew that it all began on that fateful day, September 26th, 2032, when he first set foot on the campus of the Harbin Institute of Technology.
